newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rhone-Poulenc names Langlois fin dir.
newsitem.headline: Rhone-Poulenc names Langlois fin dir.

text.p: Rhone-Poulenc said in a statement that Patrick Langlois would from July 1, 1997 become finance director of the chemcials and drugs group, reporting to his predecessor Jean-Pierre Tirouflet.
Tirouflet, group executive vice president and supervisor of the Fibres and Polymers sector, will take direct management responsibility of the sector.
Langlois was finance director of Rhone-Poulenc Rorer, where he will be succeeded by Guillaume Prache.
Prache used to be director of finance and adminstration at Rhone-Poulenc Agro.
The former head of Rhone-Poulenc's Fibers and Polymers sector, Martin Pinot, has been promoted as executive vice president of the chemical sector and president of the sector's European zone.
Pinot also joins the executive committe, as will human resources director Rene Penisson, bringing the number of members on the committee to nine.
